title: openssl@system not working at HEAD
body:
I configured spack as per the instructions in the documentation.  Specifically, I added the following to packages.yaml.
```yaml
packages:
    openssl:
        paths:
            openssl@system: /usr
        version: [system]
        buildable: False
```
Now, when I try to install a package, I get an error.  For example:
```
➜  ~ spack install julia@master+cxx+hdf5+plot                                                                                                                         [19/24142]
==> Installing julia
==> git is already installed in /home/tom/dev/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/git-2.9.3-liibyiulrje5j2jtliitmgxz5lw3hinq
==> Installing cmake
==> ncurses is already installed in /home/tom/dev/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/ncurses-6.0-7abjubw7hxme3k7dufbfuc2jw3b2tajv
==> Installing openssl
==> Warning: There is no checksum on file to fetch openssl@system safely.
  Fetch anyway? [y/N] ==> Error: EOFError: EOF when reading a line
/home/tom/dev/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:946, in do_fetch:
     927      def do_fetch(self, mirror_only=False):
     928          """
     929          Creates a stage directory and downloads the tarball for this package.
     930          Working directory will be set to the stage directory.
     931          """
     932          if not self.spec.concrete:
     933              raise ValueError("Can only fetch concrete packages.")
     934  
     935          start_time = time.time()
     936          if spack.do_checksum and self.version not in self.versions:
     937              tty.warn("There is no checksum on file to fetch %s safely." %
     938                       self.spec.format('$_$@'))
     939  
     940              # Ask the user whether to skip the checksum if we're
     941              # interactive, but just fail if non-interactive.
     942              ck_msg = "Add a checksum or use --no-checksum to skip this check."
     943              ignore_checksum = False
     944              if sys.stdout.isatty():
     945                  ignore_checksum = tty.get_yes_or_no("  Fetch anyway?",
  >> 946                                                      default=False)
     947                  if ignore_checksum:
     948                      tty.msg("Fetching with no checksum.", ck_msg)
```
Why is spack looking for a checksum for a system-installed binary?  Also, I am never given the opportunity to say "y/N".

When I passed '--no-checksum', spack tried to download 'openssl-system.tar.gz' from the openssl URL instead of using the system version.
